channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Generalized Carlos Scales
item.description: arXiv:2408.14551v2 Announce Type: new Abstract: In 1986, composer Wendy Carlos introduced three unusual musical scales she called alpha, beta and gamma, equal temperament-inspired scales that de-emphasize the octave as the primary interval in favor of the major and minor thirds and the perfect fifth. A derivation of the alpha, beta, and gamma scales due to David Benson is generalized to produce many Carlos-type scales.
item.dc:creator: Andrew V. Sills

item.title: First and Second Derivatives of the $q$-Rationals
item.description: arXiv:2309.10819v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: I prove closed-form identities that I discovered for the first and second derivatives of the $q$-rationals at $q = 1$, in which the $q$-rationals are defined as they are in arXiv:1812.00170.
item.dc:creator: Justin Lasker
